We are currently seeking talented Associate Actuary for our San Antonio, TX facility.
PURPOSE OF JOB
An ideal candidate will have the technical ability and learning agility to understand a variety of complex models and learn the programming language to implement model enhancements. The model includes the traditional insurance risks of catastrophe risk, reserve risk, and non-cat risk, but also includes the risk to the invested assets and operational risk. We model the financial impacts of each of these risks on different accounting regimes and have programmed the tax impacts and the impacts to our member dividends and distributions.
There are also plenty of opportunities to brief executives within P&C, Finance, and Risk on the output of the model to influence business decisions.
The model that is used is highly visible as it is used to set the enterprise capital and liquidity metrics. With the high visibility comes a high degree of governance. The team maintains documentation consistent with the Enterprise Model Risk Management standards and must go through annual external validations.
JOB DUTIES
Acquires and applies broad knowledge of the business, its products, and processes.
Utilizes actuarial modeling software driven models for pricing, valuation, and/or risk management. Enters data and tables, runs models, and generates reports. May make adjustments and improvements to models, when appropriate.
Maintains proper price level, price structure, data availability and other requirements to achieve profitability and competitive goals.
Identifies critical experience areas to monitor and suggest timely remedies to correct or prevent unfavorable trends. Identifies sources of gain and loss by product and assumption.
Tests pricing assumptions and the appropriate premiums, interests margins, reserves, and cash values for new products.
Resolves issues of and navigates obstacles to deliver work product. Serves as a resource to less experienced team members on escalated issues of a routine nature.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree (or 4 year of directly related work experience)
4+ years relevant business or analytical experience
4+ years actuarial experience
Advanced knowledge of actuarial technique and procedures
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools
Advanced knowledge of industry data sources
Attainment of Associate of the Casualty Actuarial Society.
Successful completion of an analyst assessment may be required.
Preferred
Capital modeling experience (Igloo)
Critical thinking
Learning agility
Programming / database management skills
Strong communication skills
Statistical modeling
The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

We are currently seeking talented Associate Life Actuary for our San Antonio, TX facility.
PURPOSE OF JOB
The Associate Life Actuary coordinates, prepares and performs actuarial analyses required to develop new products, project future results, reprice existing products, and/or determine financial strength.
JOB DUTIES
Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex to complex work assignments utilizing actuarial modeling software driven models for pricing, valuation, and/or risk management. Enters data and tables, runs models, and generates reports. May make adjustments and improvements to models, when appropriate.

Degree or equivalent work experience in lieu of a degree

Intermediate knowledge of actuarial technique and procedures, data analysis tools, and industry data sources
Advanced analytical and problem solving skills
Strong computer skills (Microsoft Office Applications, statistical analysis)
Intermediate knowledge of a programming language.
Attainment of Society of Actuaries Associateship OR attainment of ASA within specified timeframe.
Preferred
Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
4+ years of actuarial experience
Building and validating life, annuity and health models within the AXIS GGY actuarial software or any other major actuarial modeling software

We are currently seeking talented Forecasting Analyst I for our San Antonio, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO or Tampa, FL facility.
THIS POSITION IS FLEXIBLE FOR SAN ANTONIO, TX, PHOENIX, AZ, COLORADO SPRINGS, CO OR TAMPA, FL LOCATIONS.
PURPOSE OF JOB
Analyzes contact center trends, including call volumes and call patterns, to forecast workload needed to support various channels. Ensures member service needs are met through accurate forecasting in support of various business areas. Provides data and additional information to be used for capacity planning. Delivers results of analysis and recommendations to various business partners and leadership to support the USAA mission.

Creates short term and long term forecasts.
Conducts multi-dimensional short term and long term forecasting analysis to identify business issues related to workload planning.
Formulates and provides summary of analysis and recommendations to management and business leaders to assist in resolving business issues.
Navigates data and other various obstacles to deliver work product.
Extracts data from various databases and workforce management tools.
Provides advanced, in-depth analysis of workload factors for business areas with moderately complex multi-skill member contact areas.
Gathers information, business intelligence, analyzes data trends, identifies root cause(s) and provides information to business leadership or project teams.
Applies advanced knowledge of various forecasting methodologies and tools.

Bachelor's degree or 4 years equivalent forecasting or capacity planning experience.
4+ years experience scheduling, forecasting or capacity planning to include advanced utilization of workforce management tools & data analysis tools, telecommunications tools, contact routing and workload delivery systems.
2+ years utilizing and implementing forecasting methodologies.
4+ experience demonstrated application of mathematical and analytical skills applicable to workload forecasting.
Preferred
Advanced degree in Mathematics or Statistics.
Call or Contact Center Related Forecasting experience.
6+ years experience scheduling, forecasting or capacity planning to include utilization of workforce management tools & data analysis tools, telecommunications tools, contact routing and workload delivery systems.
4+ years experience utilizing and implementing forecasting methodologies for call centers with large number of multi-skill and multi-channel complexity.
Demonstrated application of mathematical and analytical skills applicable to forecasting or capacity planning.
Six Sigma Yellow Belt

Knowledge of creating and producing long term and short term staffing plans

Business acumen, Collaboration, Communication, Demonstrate Adaptability, Drive for Result and Innovation

We are currently seeking talented Modeling Analyst - Senior for our San Antonio, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO, Tampa, FL, or Chesapeake, VA facility.
Selected employee can work in SAT or any Regional Office
PURPOSE OF JOB
A strategic partner in identifying modeling opportunities and potential solutions, for short and long term business goals and results. Leads and facilitates cross-functional teams in creating models to produce substantiated recommendations and reports in support of business initiatives, efficiencies and potential strategies. This may include modeling design, development, process and utilization of sophisticated statistical modeling methods and tools. Considers risks, competitiveness and business impact of requests and builds models where in-depth evaluation of variable factors is required. Independently, under minimal supervision, with a high level of certainty, manages/performs multiple initiatives of significant scope and complexity; manages problem resolution across systems, processes or channels; and navigates obstacles to deliver the work product. A key contributor to the achievement of team / organization goals. Serves as a mentor and provides guidance to peers and less experienced team members in the design, development and implementation of statistical models.
JOB DUTIES
Applies advanced knowledge of functional and business processes and procedures, and unique modeling processes, methodologies, and techniques to create effective modeling solutions for a single or multiple business function.
Collaborates with cross-functional team in support of business case development and identifying modeling method(s) to provide business solutions. Determines the appropriate statistical and analytical methodologies to solve business problems within specific areas of expertise.
Builds models and solves complex business problems where analyses of situations and/or data require in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Considers risks, competitiveness, and business impact of requests and builds models accordingly.
Develops, proposes and owns new solutions to solve requests. Responsible for the complex end-to-end model design, development and process; ensuring adequate internal control processes around model development, implementation and validation are established.
Utilizes predictive analytics to assess future risk, opportunities, and effectiveness. Translates results into meaningful business recommendations. May present findings to various levels of leadership.
Researches and identifies industry best practices and trends to increase effectiveness. Acquires, maintains and applies advanced knowledge of the business, its products and processes, and advanced knowledge of modeling methodologies.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or related field
6+ years related work experience in statistical analysis and model development
Expert knowledge in several statistical techniques (Time Series and forecasting, Generalized linear modeling, CART, Decision Trees, Neural Networks, Factor analysis experimental design, hypothesis testing, and/or advance techniques)
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools and industry data sources
Expert knowledge in developing analysis queries and procedures in SQL, SAS, BI tools or other analysis software
Preferred
Masters or PhD degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or related field
8+ years related work experience in statistical analysis and model development
Operational Risk Modeling experience
Demonstrated leadership experience
Expert knowledge of data analysis tools and industry data sources
Expert knowledge of predictive modeling
Expert knowledge of programming language(s) and statistical techniques
One or more of the following professional designations: Associate in Risk Management(ARM or ARM-E), Professional Risk Manager(PRM), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), International Certificate in Banking Risk and Regulation(ICBRR), Six Sigma designation, Actuarial designation (FSA,ASA, FCAS, ACAS, CERA)

We are currently seeking talented Senior Data/Business Solutions Analyst for our San Antonio, TX facility.

A strategic business partner in leading the gathering of complex business requirements. Collaborates with stakeholders to define data and analytic needs. Applies an advanced level of both technical and business knowledge to provide answers or recommend solutions to business data problems which influence business strategy or decisions. Applies advanced business, technical and data knowledge to measure effectiveness and impact of change to business. Experience with DataStage
Experience leading teams in an Agile environment
